Description: Tridacna (?) shell convex button perforated in the centre and decorated with a roughly incised decoration: between two concentric circles, one around the central hole and the other near the outer edge, are scored radiant lines creating summarily the impression of three diverging lotus flowers, with curved double lines on each side and an acute triangle in the middle.
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 72 § 68 : " A button of shell (pl. xl. 16) is a new form in Egyptian remains".
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 72 § 68, pl. xl, 16)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.42, p.81, p.186, pl.28)
